properties.Name: OrderItemAllocation
properties.Description:
The reservation of Items (material) for a specific use - usually an out-bound Order - from a specific Inventory Location.

Items are allocated or reserved in a specific inventory location.

Allocation is best delayed until just prior to picking and shipping.

Note:
Since Item(s) may be allocated from one or more inventory locations, the locations components must be identifying.

Columns.Name: OrderLineNumber
Columns.Description: The number that identifies the Order Line Item.

Columns.Name: ItemSku
Columns.Description: The Stock Keeping Unit identifier, which is typically used for inventory-related activities.

Columns.Name: WarehouseLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a location.

Columns.Name: WarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: OrderId
Columns.Description: The unique number that identifies an Order.

Columns.Name: RequestedItemAllocationQuantity
Columns.Description: The quantity of Item(s) requested for allocation to the Order.

Columns.Name: AllocatedItemQuantity
Columns.Description:
The quantity of Items allocated.

Allocations are done by Item not Inventory Location.    

If a product can be stored in more than one location, employees must record the actual storage locations affected every time material is moved.

Columns.Name: ItemVarianceQuantity
Columns.Description: The quantity of Item(s) that is on variance for the allocation.

Columns.Name: AllocationInstruction
Columns.Description: Special instructions regarding the allocation of the Item(s) for the Order.

Columns.Name: AllocationVarianceReasonId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Allocation Variance Reason.

Properties.Description:
The reservation of Items (material) for a specific use - usually an out-bound Order - from a specific Inventory Location.

Items are allocated or reserved in a specific inventory location.

Allocation is best delayed until just prior to picking and shipping.

Note:
Since Item(s) may be allocated from one or more inventory locations, the locations components must be identifying.
